src:
Nasi Tempong Indra : Ditendang Pedasnya Sambal khas Banyuwangi di Pulau Dewata
01 Nov 2019, 05:15 by Devi Setya - detikFood


Foto: Devi S. Lestari/detikFood

Jakarta - Mencari kuliner halal di Bali tidaklah sulit. Banyak tempat makan dengan sajian makanan enak dengan jaminan halal. Salah satunya Nasi Tempong Indra di kawasan Kuta.Nasi Tempong memang bukan makanan khas Bali melainkan asal Banyuwangi Jawa Timur. Racikan nasi rames khas Jawa Timuran ini ternyata cukup populer di Pulau Dewata. Ini karena jaraknya sangat dekat dengan Bali. Tak heran jika banyak makanan Banyuwangi yang populer di sini. Seperti kedai Nasi Tempong Indra tak pernah sepi pengunjung.


Foto: Devi S. Lestari/detikFood

Sebelum masuk ke area dalam, kami disambut oleh cobek besar berisi sambal yang tampaknya baru saja diulek. Di pinggir cobek juga ditaruh irisan jeruk limo yang tertata rapi. Penggemar pedas sudah pasti tergoda. Menarik!Baru melihat dan mencium aroma pedas sambal ini saja rasanya sudah bikin ngiler. Kami lantas masuk ke area restoran dengan bangunan luas berinterior serba kayu. Areanya sengaja dibuat seperti rumah joglo Jawa dengan konsep semi outdoor.Menu andalan di sini cukup banyak tapi kami memutuskan untuk menyantap dua menu andalannya yakni sepaket nasi tempong ayam dan nasi tempong bebek. Oya, porsinya juga bisa disesuaikan selera mau ukuran ayam dan bebek setengah ekor atau seperempat ekor.Ciri khas nasi tempong adalah penyajiannya yang komplit terdiri dari nasi, lauk, sayuran dan sambal. Porsinya juga jumbo jadi dijamin puas dan kenyang. Yang jadi primadona nasi tempong adalah sambal dadaknya.Untuk paket nasi tempong di kedai Indra ini terdiri dari nasi, lauk pilihan, ikan asin, tempe dan tahu goreng serta sayuran rebus mulai dari bayam,kangkung, labu dan mentimun. Jagoannya jangan lupa yakni semangkuk sambal super pedas.


Foto: Devi S. Lestari/detikFood

Aroma sedap nasi tempong membuat kami tak sabar melahapnya. Ayam dan bebek goreng di sini diungkep dengan bumbu berlimpah sehingga rasa gurih sedap meresap hingga ke tulang.Supaya makin nendang, kami mencoba mencicip sambalnya. Wah, sambal pelengkap nasi tempong ini juara pedasnya. Makan sedikit saja sengatan pedasnya langsung bikin keringat bercucuran.Racikan cabai merah, rawit merah, terasi dan sedikit bawang putih membuat sambal ini istimewa. Apalagi diulek segar. Jangan lupa kucurkan air jeruk limau untuk sensasi rasa yang asam segar.


Foto: Devi S. Lestari/detikFood

Meskipun lidah seolah terbakar, sambal ini punya daya pikat yang bikin nagih. Santap juga dengan sayuran rebusnya yang sederhana tapi istimewa.Bebek goreng gaya Jawa Timur ini berbeda dengan bebek goreng Bali. Bebek berwarna gelap ini sekilas mirip bebek Surabaya yang berwarna gelap dengan rasa bumbu dominan gurih, sementara bebek goreng Bali cenderung berwarna kuning cerah.Bebek digoreng garing namun tidak membuat teksturnya keras dan alot. Bagian kulit bebek juga tidak terlalu berlemak dan renyah disantap langsung. Mantap!Selain lauk ayam dan bebek, nasi tempong juga bisa dinikmati dengan lauk ikan gurame, belut, cumi, empal dan ikan lele. Seporsi menu di sini dibanderol mulai Rp 30 ribu hingga Rp 75 ribu.Nasi Tempong IndraJl. Dewi Sri No. 788Kuta, BaliTelepon : 081234583033 Simak Video "Jajanan Western di Banyuwangi Ini Bikin Ngiler!"[Gambas:Video 20detik](dvs/odi)
text:
Tempong Indra Rice: Kicked Spicy Sambal Banyuwangi typical on the Island of the Gods
01 Nov 2019, 05:15 by Devi Setya - detikFood


Photo: Devi S. Lestari / detikFood

Jakarta - Finding halal cuisine in Bali is not difficult. Many places to eat with good food offerings with halal guarantee. One of them is Tempong Indra Rice in Kuta. Tempong Rice is not a typical Balinese food but from Banyuwangi, East Java. This unique mixture of East Java rames rice is quite popular on the Island of the Gods. This is because the distance is very close to Bali. No wonder so many Banyuwangi foods are popular here. Like Tempong Indra's rice stall, it is never empty of visitors.


Photo: Devi S. Lestari / detikFood

Before entering the inner area, we were greeted by a large mortar containing chili which seemed to have just been ground. At the edge of the mortar also placed neatly arranged limo slices. Spicy fans are definitely tempted. Interesting! Just seeing and smelling the spicy aroma of this chili sauce is already making you drool. We then entered the restaurant area with a large wooden interior building. The area is deliberately made like a Javanese joglo house with a semi outdoor concept. The mainstay menu here is quite a lot but we decided to eat two of its flagship menus namely a package of chicken tempong rice and duck tempong rice. Anyway, the portions can also be adjusted to taste the size of chicken and duck half-tail or quarter-tail. Characteristic of rice tempong is a complete presentation consisting of rice, side dishes, vegetables and sambal. The portions are also jumbo so they are guaranteed to be satisfied and full. The prima donna of tempong rice is its chili sauce. For the tempong rice package at the Indra shop it consists of rice, side dishes, salted fish, fried tempeh and tofu and boiled vegetables ranging from spinach, kale, pumpkin and cucumber. Don't forget the hero, a bowl of super spicy chili sauce.


Photo: Devi S. Lestari / detikFood

The delicious aroma of tempong rice makes us impatient to devour it. Fried chicken and duck here are covered with abundant spices so that the savory taste soaked up to the bone. In order to be more kicked, we tried tasting the chilli sauce. Wow, this complementing tempong chili sauce is the spicy champion. Eating just a little bit of the spicy sting immediately makes sweat trickle down. The mixture of red chili, red cayenne, shrimp paste and a little garlic make this special chili sauce. Moreover freshly grounded. Don't forget to pour the lime juice for a fresh, sour taste sensation.


Photo: Devi S. Lestari / detikFood

Even though the tongue seems to be burning, this chilli has an alluring appeal. Eat it with its simple but special boiled vegetables. This East Java style fried duck is different from Balinese fried duck. This dark duck looks like a Surabaya duck which is dark with a taste of savory spices, while Balinese fried duck tends to be bright yellow. The duck is fried crispy but does not make the texture hard and tough. The skin of the duck is also not too fatty and crispy eaten directly. Great! Besides chicken and duck dishes, tempong rice can also be enjoyed with side dishes of carp, eels, squid, empal and catfish. A menu here is priced from Rp 30 thousand to Rp 75 thousand. Rice Tempong Indra Jl. Dewi Sri No. 788Kuta, Bali Phone: 081234583033 Watch Video "This Western Snack in Banyuwangi Makes You Drool!" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (dvs / odi)
